newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Uniden Manila unit shuts plant after strike.
newsitem.headline: Uniden Manila unit shuts plant after strike.

text.p: Uniden Philippines Inc said on Wednesday it decided to temporarily shut down its plant in Taguig, south of Manila, due to violence by employees staging a strike.
In a statement, Uniden said "the strikers have resorted to harassment, intimidation, physical violence on company workers, destruction of company property and other illegal acts...."
The closure of the cellular phone component plant will ensure the safety of the majority of its 4,000 employees, the company said.
The strike is being staged by a labour union with 200 member employees. The union could not be immediately reached for comment.
The company did not say when it plans to resume operations.
Uniden Philippines exports the entire output of its plant to its parent firm Uniden Corp.
Uniden Corp makes mobile telephones, cordless telephones and satellite broadcasting receivers.
